verses.verse: "I am the rose <WH2261> of Sharon, <WH8289> The lily <WH7799> of the valleys. <WH6010>"
"Like a lily <WH7799> among <WH996> the thorns, <WH2336> So <WH3651> is my darling <WH7474> among <WH996> the maidens. <WH1323>"

"Like an apple <WH8598> tree <WH8598> among the trees <WH6086> of the forest, <WH9194> So <WH3651> is my beloved <WH1730> among <WH996> the young <WH1121> men. <WH1121> In his shade <WH6738> I took <WH2530> great delight <WH2530> and sat <WH3427> down, <WH3427> And his fruit <WH6529> was sweet <WH4966> to my taste. <WH2441>
"He has brought <WH935> me to [his] banquet <WH3196> hall, <WH1004> And his banner <WH1714> over <WH5921> me is love. <WH160>
"Sustain <WH5564> me with raisin <WH809> cakes, <WH809> Refresh <WH7502> me with apples, <WH8598> Because <WH3588> I am lovesick. <WH2470> <WH160>
"[Let] his left <WH8040> hand <WH8040> be under <WH8478> my head <WH7218> And his right <WH3225> hand <WH3225> embrace <WH2263> me."

"I adjure <WH7650> you, O daughters <WH1323> of Jerusalem, <WH3389> By the gazelles <WH6643> or <WH176> by the hinds <WH355> of the field, <WH7704> That you will not arouse <WH5782> or awaken <WH5782> [my] love, <WH160> Until <WH5704> she pleases. <WH2654>"
"Listen! <WH6963> My beloved! <WH1730> Behold, <WH2009> he is coming, <WH935> Climbing <WH1801> on the mountains, <WH2022> Leaping <WH7092> on the hills! <WH1389>

"My beloved <WH1730> is like <WH1819> a gazelle <WH6643> or <WH176> a young <WH6082> stag. <WH354> Behold, <WH2009> he is standing <WH5975> behind <WH310> our wall, <WH3796> He is looking <WH7688> through <WH4480> the windows, <WH2474> He is peering <WH9473> through <WH4480> the lattice. <WH2762>
"My beloved <WH1730> responded <WH6030> and said <WH559> to me, 'Arise, <WH6965> my darling, <WH7474> my beautiful <WH3303> one, <WH3303> And come <WH1980> along.
'For behold, <WH2009> the winter <WH5638> is past, <WH5674> The rain <WH1653> is over <WH2498> [and] gone. <WH1980>

'The flowers <WH5339> have [already] appeared <WH7200> in the land; <WH776> The time <WH6256> has arrived <WH5060> for pruning <WH2159> [the vines,] And the voice <WH6963> of the turtledove <WH8449> has been heard <WH8085> in our land. <WH776>

'The fig <WH8384> tree <WH8384> has ripened <WH2590> its figs, <WH6291> And the vines <WH1612> in blossom <WH5563> have given <WH5414> forth [their] fragrance. <WH7381> Arise, <WH6965> my darling, <WH7474> my beautiful <WH3303> one, <WH3303> And come <WH1980> along!' "

"O my dove, <WH3123> in the clefts <WH2288> of the rock, <WH5553> In the secret <WH5643> place <WH5643> of the steep <WH4095> pathway, <WH4095> Let me see <WH7200> your form, <WH4758> Let me hear <WH8085> your voice; <WH6963> For your voice <WH6963> is sweet, <WH6156> And your form <WH4758> is lovely. <WH5000>"
"Catch <WH270> the foxes <WH7776> for us, The little <WH6996> foxes <WH7776> that are ruining <WH2254> the vineyards, <WH3754> While our vineyards <WH3754> are in blossom. <WH5563>"
"My beloved <WH1730> is mine, and I am his; He pastures <WH7462> [his flock] among the lilies. <WH7799>

"Until <WH5704> the cool <WH6315> of the day <WH3117> when the shadows <WH6738> flee <WH5127> away, Turn, <WH5437> my beloved, <WH1730> and be like <WH1819> a gazelle <WH6643> Or <WH176> a young <WH6082> stag <WH354> on the mountains <WH2022> of Bether. <WH1336>"
